sub_topic: Calculating the circumference of a circle.
message_1: A circular race track has a radius of 120 meters. What is the circumference of the race track?
message_2:
The circumference of a circle is given by the formula C = 2πr, where C is the circumference and r is the radius of the circle.

In this case, the radius of the circular race track is 120 meters. So, we can find the circumference by plugging the radius into the formula:

C = 2π(120)
C ≈ 2 × 3.14159 × 120
C ≈ 753.98 meters

The circumference of the race track is approximately 753.98 meters.
